content.description: Start on the right side of the overhung face by pulling into the lower rock as per "Falling Cradle" and "Floating Door" but move up the overhang without using the arete, instead using a little pocket for LH and an opposing edge for the RH to stand up. Top out as per bough breaker.
content.protection: I've only found 1 pad necessary, but if you aren't comfortable with the 15ft height or the grade you'll want more and or a spotter
content.location: On the right-middle part of the Bow Boulder.

content.description: Start on the left side of the overhung face, by pulling onto the lower rock. Continue up and left onto the flat face, this flowy route has an easy top out too.
content.location: This route is on the far left side of the bow boulder.

content.description: Begin on the right side of the overhung face by pulling on to the lower rock. Climb to the arete and exit early onto the right slab.
content.location: This route is on the right side of the Bow Boulder.

content.description: Begin on the right side of the overhung face by pulling into the lower rock. Work your way up the right side of the overhang using both the arete and face holds.
content.location: On the right-middle part of the Bow Boulder.

content.description: Start on the left side of the overhung face, by pulling into the lower rock. Ascend directly up the face of the boulder following the crack.
content.location: This route is on the left-middle part of the Bow Boulder.

content.description: Start on the right side of the overhung face by pulling on to the lower rock, as per "Floating Door" or "Falling Cradle" (or by downclimbing Floating Door). Traverse to the left, staying reasonably low. Finish at the far left of the boulder or on Scandanavian.
content.protection: None needed. Its low with a good landing.
content.location: Start on the right side of bow boulder

content.description: Start as far left as you can on the boulder - I believe you can start on 2 edges left of the alternate start for scandanvian. Traverse to the right, staying reasonably low. Can optionally finish on Floating door or falling cradle.
content.protection: None needed, low with a flat landing
content.location: Start on the left side of Bow Boulder

content.description: Begin by pulling into the lower rock on the left side of the overhung face, however a series of shouldery moves allow you to climb diagonal up and to the right across the overhung face. More good holds greet you at the top to aid with the mantle.
content.location: This rout is on the middle of the Bow Boulder.
